title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: Cockatoos have learned to operate drinking fountains in Australia
items.description: The behavior—never before seen in birds—may be a developing cultural tradition among one population

items.title: DNA captured from the air could track wildlife, invasive species—and humans
items.description: Technology could be a boon for science, but raises ethical concerns

items.title: Long-running physics experiment dashes hope of new particles and forces
items.description: Muon is just as magnetic as predicted, requiring no new theory to explain

items.title: National Academies, staggering from Trump cuts, on brink of dramatic downsizing
items.description: Plan for slashed units and mission to be presented at governor’s meeting next week

items.title: Trump’s proposed budget details drastic cuts to biomedical research and global health
items.description: CDC takes a bigger hit than expected; support for international HIV, malaria, TB, and vaccine efforts zeroed out

items.title: This octopus grew a ninth arm—which soon developed a mind of its own
items.description: Study highlights just how flexible cephalopod’s bodies are after injury and during recovery

items.title: Ancient poop yields world’s oldest butterfly fossils
items.description: Tiny wing scales suggest the proboscis evolved 100 million years before flowers

items.title: Explosive mpox outbreak in Sierra Leone overwhelms health systems
items.description: Rapid transmission through sexual networks raises fears of wider spread in the region

items.title: Final NSF budget proposal jettisons one giant telescope amid savage agencywide cuts
items.description: Trump’s 57% proposed cut to agency would drop grant success rates to 7% and gut education and training

items.title: ‘Devastating’: NIH cancels future funding plans for HIV vaccine consortia
items.description: Researchers decry agency’s decision just as new leads reinvigorate search for long-sought vaccine
